events.title: Victory in Europe Day (VE Day)
events.description: The Allies formally accepted Nazi Germany's unconditional surrender, marking the end of World War II in Europe.
events.significance: It signifies the official end of WWII in Europe and is celebrated as a day of victory and remembrance in many countries.

events.title: End of the American Civil War
events.description: Union General Gordon Granger arrived in Texas and announced the emancipation of enslaved people, effectively ending the Civil War in the last Confederate territory.
events.significance: This event marked the abolition of slavery in the United States and the final collapse of the Confederacy.

events.title: Start of the Korean War
events.description: North Korean forces crossed the 38th parallel, invading South Korea and initiating the Korean War.
events.significance: The war had significant Cold War implications and shaped geopolitics in East Asia for decades.

events.title: The Birth of the European Football Championship
events.description: The first European Nations' Cup (now UEFA European Championship) began qualifying matches.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of one of the most prestigious football tournaments in the world.

events.title: Death of Napoleon Bonaparte
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte, the former Emperor of France and a central figure in European history, died in exile on the island of Saint Helena.
events.significance: His death closed a significant chapter in European history characterized by upheaval and reforms.
